description: Part 2 in Peter Parker's experience at "Spring Break."
name: Fifteen Minutes of Shame Part 2

description:
"Mister Z!" Who is the mysterious Mr. Z? Can Superman find out the answer to that very question before he ends up spending eternity in imprisonment?

Notes:

  • First $1.00 issue.
  • Triangle 1991 #1.
  • Mr. Z takes the name George Bailey as an alias.
  • Chronological continuation from Action Comics #660.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #474.
name: Mister Z!

person_credits.name: Jerry Ordway
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, inker, colorist, cover

description:
The Name, Pardners, is Terra-Man!" The ecological terrorist Terra-Man is back and LexCorp is going to pay. This time Manning crosses the line and an innocent man pays the price. Can Superman stop him before Lois becomes the next victim in Terra-Man's war on corporate America?

Notes:

  • Triangle 1991 #4.
  • Chronological continuation from Action Comics #661.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #475.
name: The Name, Pardners, is Terra-Man...

description:
The Man of Steel has always stood for "Truth, Justice, and the American Way," but will he step into the realm of world politics when the government requests that he forcibly oust a foreign dictator from office?

Plus, in the wake of Clark Kent revealing his duel identity to Lois (see Action Comics #662), Mrs. Lane must now sort out what it means to be the wife of Superman.

Notes:

  • Triangle 1991 #7.
  • Chronological continuation from Action Comics #662.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #476.
name: Truth, Justice and the American Way

person_credits.name: Jerry Ordway
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, inker, colorist, cover

description:
"Time and Time Again" part 3 "The Warsaw Ghetto!". The Man of Steel battles the Third Reich after the nigh omnipotent Spectre transports Superman back in time to the days of World War II.

The Man of Steel battles the Third Reich in this time spanning epic. The nigh omnipotent Spectre has transported Superman back in time to the days of World War II to confront an enemy from his past (see Superman #51 for Mr. Z's 1st app.). Plus, the back-up tale "Attack of the D.N.Alien!" Part 1 of 2. Starring the Guardian and the Newsboy Legion.

Notes:

  • "The Warsaw Ghetto" written and penciled by Jerry Ordway, inked by Dennis Janke, colored by Glenn Whitmore and lettered by John Costanza.
  • "Attack of the D.N.Alien!" written, penciled and inked by Karl Kesel, colored by Glenn Whitmore and lettered by Bill Oakley.
  • Mr. Z takes the alias General Zeiten.
  • Triangle 1991 #10.
  • Chronological continuation from Action Comics #663.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #477.
name: The Warsaw Ghetto / Attack of the D.N.Alien!

description:
"Time and Time Again" part 6. Superman continues his adventure through time, fighting side-by-side with the vicious Demon to save the legendary Kingdom of Camelot.

Time and Time Again! Phase 6. "Camelot!" Guest-starring Etrigan, the Demon. Cameo by the Shining Knight. Superman continues his adventure through time. In this chapter the Man of Steel must fight side-by-side with the vicious Demon to save the legendary Kingdom of Camelot. Story concludes in Adventures of Superman #478. Plus, the back-up tale "Blaze of Glory!" Part 2 of 2. Starring the Guardian and the Newsboy Legion.

Notes:

  • "Camelot" written, penciled and inked by Jerry Ordway, colored by Glenn Whitmore and lettered by John Costanza.
  • "Blaze of Glory!" written, penciled and inked by Karl Kesel, colored by Glenn Whitmore, lettered by Bill Oakley and "soul and inspiration" by Jack Kirby.
  • Triangle 1991 #13.
  • Chronological continuation from Action Comics #664.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #478.
name: Camelot / Blaze of Glory!

person_credits.name: Jerry Ordway
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, inker, colorist, cover

description:
"Red Glass!" Part 1 of 3. Superman suddenly finds himself in a world where all his arch villains have been slain...by him. And the public at large lives in fear of what he may do next. Can the Man of Steel solve this mystery and find out what is happening before it's too late? Story continues in Adventures of Superman #479. Plus, the back-up tale "Charlie & Company!" Starring the Guardian and the Newsboy Legion.

Notes:

  • "Breaking Up" written by James D. Hudvall, penciled by Ed Hannigan, inked by Willie Blyberg, colored by Glenn Whitmore and lettered by John Costanza.
  • "Charlie & Company" written, penciled and inked by Karl Kesel, colored by Glenn Whitmore and lettered by Bill Oakley.
  • "Superman's Day of Wrath" takes place on April 15, 1998.
  • Triangle 1991 #16.
  • Chronological continuation from Action Comics #665.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #479.
name: Breaking Up / Charlie & Company

description:
The Mark of the Krypton Man! Part 1 of 3. Featuring the 1st appearance of the Eradicator (in anthropoid form). A powerful being with ties to Superman's past decides that the Last Son of Krypton is not living up to his heritage, and decides to recreate a dead world here on Earth.

  1. Pages 1-7 penciled by Dan Jurgens and inked by Brett Breeding.
  2. Pages 8-9, 14-16 and 25 penciled by Bob McLeod and inked by Denis Rodier.
  3. Pages 10-13 and 22-23 penciled by Jon Bogdanove and inked by Dennis Janke.
  4. Pages 17-21 penciled and inked by Art Thibert.
  5. Pages 24, 26-30 penciled by Tom Grummett and inked by Jerry Ordway.
  6. Pages 31-38 penciled by Dan Jurgens and inked by Bob McLeod.

Notes:

  • Cameo flashback appearances of the Klerik and Elastic Lad.
  • Jimmy Olsen is laid off at the Daily Planet.
  • 48 page issue.
  • Triangle 1991 #20.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #1.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #480.
name: The Return of the Krypton Man

description:
Superman is a being with abilities far beyond those of ordinary men. This is a fact that makes some people very nervous. If the Man of Steel ever were to turn on mankind, who would be there to keep him in check? Meet the Watchdogs.

"Fangs of the Bloodhounds!" Guest-starring the Guardian. Superman is a being with abilities far beyond those of ordinary men. This is a fact that makes some people very nervous. If the Man of Steel ever were to turn on mankind, who would be there to keep him in check. Meet the Watchdogs!

Notes:

  • Cameo flashback appearance of Superman as Gangbuster.
  • Triangle 1991 #24.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #2.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #481.
name: Fangs of the Bloodhounds

description:
"Superman's Fiancee, Lois Lane!" A secret cabal gathers to discuss items that pertain to the death of an innocent man. Plus, this issue explores what it's like to be the fiancee of the most powerful and busiest super hero on Earth. Includes a 5-page excerpt from the Daily Planet by Lois Lane.

Notes:

  • Five pages of the Daily Planet newspaper dated Friday July 28 1991 are included at the end of the story.
  • Triangle 1991 #28.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #3.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #482.
name: Superman's Fiancee Lois Lane

description:
Clark Kent sets out to shut down Intergang once and for all. But when a Boom Tube from Apokolips shows up this turns into a job...for Superman.

Clark Kent sets out to shut down Intergang once and for all. But when a Boom Tube from Apokolips shows up this turns into a job for Superman! Plus, introducing a new force for good who just may turn out to be the back up Superman needs at the right time.

Notes:

  • The first appearance of Agent Liberty.
  • Triangle 1991 #32.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #4.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #483.
name: Intergang - - No More!

first_appearance_locations.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

location_credits.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

description:
"Time and Time Again, Again!" Guest-starring the Metal Men. Superman has a tough decision to make. Is the mysterious Waverider attempting to destroy the time stream, or is he out to save many innocent lives from certain death. With the Linear Men hot on the golden time-traveler's trail, the Man of Steel does not have long to make up his mind.

Notes:

  • Adolph Hitler and Linear Man cameo flashback appearances.
  • Triangle 1991 #36.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #5.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #484.
name: Time and Time Again Again!

description:
"Blackout" part 4. With the Man of Steel MIA, it's up to Gangbuster, Agent of Liberty and Thorn to keep the city safe for the citizens of Metropolis until his return.

Black Out! Part 4 of 5. "Wedding Daze!" Guest-starring the Guardian, Gangbuster, Agent of Liberty and Thorn. With the Man of Steel MIA, it's up to Gangbuster, Agent of Liberty and Thorn to keep the city safe for the citizens of Metropolis until his return. Meanwhile, star investigative reporter Lois Lane, Professor Hamilton and the Guardian search for her missing fiancee.

Notes:

  • "- - with special thanks to story-meister Dennis Janke!"
  • A 16 page free insert for Sonic the Hedgehog.
  • Triangle 1991 #40.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #6.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #485.
name: Wedding Daze

description:
When the Atlantis/Oumland War spills over and threatens the surface world Superman decides it's time to get involved, with or without the Lord of the Seven Seas blessing.

Clark and Cat are out on a ship surveying the seas for a story Cat is planning to report on. A possible outbreak of war between Atlantis and Oumland is brewing. While on board they are attacked by a Plesiosaur and fall overboard. Superman and Aquaman work together to fight the creature but are interrupted by torpedoes headed towards Atlantis. They go after the torpedoes, while Superman is taking hold of one he crashes it into a the side of a rock and is injured, it is then that he gets help from someone dear in his past.

Notes:

  • Triangle 1992 #2.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #7.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #486.
name: Shadows from the Past!

description:
"Metropolis Mailbag!" Special guest-appearance by Bruce Wayne (Batman). In this special Christmas issue, Superman spends the night reading letters from around the world asking for his help. Though the Last Son of Krypton can bend steel with his bare hands, change the course of mighty rivers, and leap tall buildings in a single bound, there are still some things even a Superman can't do. Get the tissues ready, this one pulls at the heart strings.

Notes:

  • Lana Lang cameo headshot appearance.
  • Triangle 1992 #6.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #8.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #487.
name: Metropolis Mailbag

description:
"Panic in the Sky" part 2. Even Superman can't stand alone against the power of Warworld. So the Man of Steel gathers the toughest group of super-heroes ever assembled, Dirty Dozen-style, but will even they be enough to stop this new threat?

The cosmically astute Metron has visited Almerac. He is speechless to see the civilisation reduced to ruins by Warworld's attack. He is musing when he is suddenly attacked telepathically by Brainiac. He is captured but manages to teleport his Mobius Chair to Earth.

Meanwhile, Dubbilex, Superman and Guardian are removing the debris inside Project Cadmus when the Mobius Chair appears. Dubbilex senses that something sinister has befallen Metron. While they are at this, the Gods Orion and Lightray appear in search of Metron. Superman informs them that Warworld has captured Metron. They leave for Warworld without heeding to Superman's warnings.

Upon Warworld, Orion and Lightray are quickly subdued by, Supergirl, Maxima and other warriors.

Superman is telepathically mocked by Brainiac. He realises that he will need the help of other heroes to win this battle. So he contacts Lex Luthor for equipment and then goes out in search of others.

Superman requests Deathstroke to be his team's field leader, meets Diana and Aquaman and then broadcasts the news all over the World. Heroes assemble from all over the World to listen to Superman.

Meanwhile, Aquaman is attacked underwater by Brainiac's Headship and captured. The Headship appears outside the Heroes' headquarters with him.

Notes:

  • Triangle 1992 #10.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #9.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #488.
name: Head Man

description:
"Panic in the Sky" part 6. It's the final battle for the fate of mankind. The heroes of Earth press the attack to confront Warworld once and for all, but Brainiac's final solution may prove the deadliest attack of all.

Warworldâs hordes are arriving in large numbers. Batmanâs ground unit is doing its best to keep them at bay. Prof. Hamilton has rigged up a dispersal cannon. He and Luthor fire it at the hordes. Jimmy wonders what is happening inside Warworld.

Maxima pledges to fight beside the heroes, because Brainiac has treated her like a slave. Superman does not want her help, because he knows her nature. She has been trouble from the first day she has appeared on Earth. Kilowog and Wonder Woman say that Maxima would never make a sacrifice like Draaga. Maxima is insulted and gears up for attack. But Deathstroke stops them, saying that they have a more important mission. Superman has already used his x-ray vision to isolate three access routes to reach Brainiac. Agent Liberty says that they should split into three groups. Deathstroke puts himself, Metron and Superman in charge of one group each. Maxima wants to join them but Superman denies her permission. She keeps Guy and the Metal-Men in charge of her safe-keeping.

The three groups head for Brainiac from three different sides. Flash has been given the responsibility to breach Brainiacâs defenses. But he does not achieve his goal. Brainiac uses electricity to knock him out. Then he unleashes the most powerful weapon on Warworld, himself. Brainiac uses the âAugmentation Systemâ to magnify his telepathic powers a thousand times, unleashing what appears to be a âpsychic death radiationâ. The heroes are forced to retreat and many civilians caught in the radius of the radiation disintegrate. Brainiac has built an impenetrable force-field around himself.

Next, Brainiac deploys hovering discs over Metropolis. The discs interconnect to form an unbreakable energy-grid, which even the heroesâ laser-rifles cannot destroy.

Back on Warworld, Superman says that their groups are no match for Brainiacâs power. Dubbilex warns them that Brainiac has already initiated his plan of reducing Metropolis to table-top size. Superman orders a suicide mission to stop Brainiac.

Maxima plays Guy and the Metal-Men to allow her a chance to attack Brainiac. She is surprised that Guy is taking orders from Superman. Guy is insulted and offers to free Maxima for help in taking down Brainiac. He uses his ring to create a pathway to the central chamber for Maxima and the Metal-Men. The operation is partially successful. Maxima is undamaged but the Metal-Men have obviously taken the radiation hit. But even Maxima falls before Brainiacâs psychic power. Flash plays a desperate gamble. He picks up a shard of glass and hurls it towards the cables connecting Brainiac to Warworld. Maxima takes the chance. She attacks a now diminished Brainiac.

Some of the heroes appear on earth via a boom tube and crush the energy-discs, thus breaking up the energy grid.

Brainiac tries a last chance to save himself from Maxima. He crawls with death-like slowness and is successful in ejecting a sphere outside of Warworld. Maxima is stopped by Superman. But Brainiac is lobotomized. His brain is gone.

Notes:

  • The title of the story is a homage to the DC Comics war series Our Army at War.
  • Triangle 1992 #14.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #10.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #489.
name: Our Army at War

description:
Panic in the Sky! Epilogue. "Another Panic in the Sky!" In the aftermath of Earth's epic battle with Warworld, is Superman in any shape to beat back the cosmic planet-scavengers who swarm in Warworld's wake? Can Lex Luthor prevail where the Man of Steel has failed?

Notes:

  • Triangle 1992 #18.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #11.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #490.
name: Another Panic in the Sky!

description:
Slade Wilson is a wanted man. Now, the Man of Steel sets out to bring down one of the most dangerous men alive!

"Sins of the Father!" Part 1 of 2. Guest-starring Deathstroke. Slade Wilson is a wanted man (see Deathstroke the Terminator #1-5 for why). Now, the Man of Steel sets out to bring down one of the most dangerous men alive! Get ready for a game of cat and mouse the likes of which has never been seen before.

Notes:

  • The story continues in Deathstroke the Terminator #12.
  • Triangle 1992 #22.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #12.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #491.
name: Sins of the Father

description:
"...Killing is Serious Business!" Part 1 of 2. Pete Ross is put on trial and his only hope for salvation lies in the hands of Agent Liberty. But can the Agent be trusted, or will Pete be left to the mercies of the Sons of Liberty?

Notes:

  • Cameo flashback appearance of President Marlo of Qurac.
  • Triangle 1992 #26.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #13.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #492.
name: --Killing is Serious Business!

description:
Superman spends the night reading letters from around the world asking for his help. Though the Last Son of Krypton can bend steel with his bare hands, change the course of mighty rivers, and leap tall buildings in a single bound, there are still some things even a Superman can't do.

"Raising the Stakes!" Guest-starring Robin. Jimmy Olsen's girlfriend has fallen into the thrall of a vampire. Can Superman, his pal, and the Boy Wonder find Lucy and save the poor girl's soul before it's too late?

Notes:

  • Triangle 1992 #30.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #14.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #493.
name: Raising the Stakes!

description:
Superman is caught between two warring demons and even he may not have the power to stop them both.

Blaze-Satanus War! Part 4 of 4. "Evil Pawn!" Superman is caught in the middle of two warring demons and even he may not have the power to stop them both. The Man of Steel is forced to choose a side in this demonic battle, and his decision may cost him his very soul.

Notes:

  • Cameo hallucination appearance of Jerry White.
  • Triangle 1992 #34.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #15.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #494.
name: Evil's Pawn

description:
Superman will stand idly by no more after witnessing the injustices felt by one woman at the hands of her abusive husband. Not even the law can stop the Man of Steel!

Crisis at Hand. Part 2 of 2. "Rage!" Superman was forced by law to stand by powerless and helpless to prevent the abuse of a woman by her abusive husband. But he can't stand idly by any longer. This 2-part tale takes look at the serious and an all too real problem of spousal abuse.

Notes:

  • Triangle 1992 #38.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #16.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #495.
name: Rage

description:
Doomsday: Prologue. "Time Ryders!" Waverider and the Linear Men have always been at odds about how to monitor the time stream. But the unexpected happens when the Linear Men actually ask the golden time-traveler to join their team. But can Superman stand idly by while the Linear Men possess this much power over time? Does he have a choice? Plus, on the last page, powerful pounding fists are the harbinger of quite possibly the most dangerous threat the Earth has ever faced, and the issue ends with the ominous warning "...Doomsday is coming!"

Notes:

  • Triangle 1992 #42.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #17.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #496.
name: Time Ryders

description:
SUPERMAN is here to save the day, But will he. As Superman comes to aid the Justice League he has his first confrontation with the destructive DOOMSDAY. Will Superman and the Justice league defeat this monster?! Will they be defeated and leave the world to the devastating Doomsday?! Read this issue to find Out!!!!

Notes:

  • The story continues from Justice League America #69.
  • Triangle 1992 #46.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #18.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #497.
name: Countdown to Doomsday!

description:
Superman #75 is the famous issue where Superman is killed by Doomsday. Each page is a full page shot of the intense battle. Superman and Doomsday just exchange blows one after another. Superman eventually defeats Doomsday at the cost of his own life.

Black Bag (Memorial Collector's Edition)

It is a Direct Market Memorial Collector's Edition. Comes in a black polybag with card, poster, stamps, Daily Planet Obituary & black armband included inside the sealed bag.

Black Bag (Platinum Edition)

Retailer exclusive. This version was not available to the same commercial outlets as anyone could sell normal comics, this certain comic was retailer protected.

*Contents need to be confirmed if the same as the standard Memorial Collector's Edition.

Notes:

  • Newstand and direct sales editions priced at $1.25.
  • Bagged memorial edition priced at $2.50.
  • Newstand cover by Dan Jurgens and Brett Breeding.
  • Direct sales cover computer animated by Eric Kachelhofer.
  • Newstand first printing cover is identified by the lettering in yellow.
  • Newstand second printing cover is identified by the lettering in white.
  • Newstand third printing cover is identified by the lettering in blue.
  • Newstand fourth printing cover is identified by the lettering in green.
  • Each page consists of one panel.
  • The end of the Death of Superman story arc. Continues in the Funeral for a Friend story arc in Adventures of Superman #498.
name: Doomsday!

description:
The JLA arrive in Metropolis and read letters from people needing help--just as Superman once did. Heroes and everyday citizens alike try to come together to cope with Superman's death.

Superman is dead? Actually no, he's being reanimated/regenerated but no one knows about this. This issue begins on Christmas Eve. Various heroes are there and Captain Marvel arrives. Ironically it is raining not snowing. Aquaman likes it and Green Lantern does too. Nightwing can't believe it and the new Robin Tim Drake in a moment out of character decides not to remark for fear of sounding like an idiot (huh?). So since Superman is dead the heroes decide to get down to business whatever that may be at this point..

We then see a kid named Mitch whose house was destroyed in a fight between Superman and Doomsday in Ohio where we all know Superman's creators were raised (Ohio). Mitch must have run away from home since he is seen walking the streets of Metropolis. Poor Mitch he feels its his fault Superman died. Some wacko has a press conference and says she is Mrs. Superman and that they lived in a New York penthouse and had vacations all over the world and he took her there to protect her from his enemies. We all know it is bull and Lois Lane and Jimmy Olsen are there too. Of course we know it's a lie.

Lois leaves and Jimmy sees Mitch. They talk for a bit and Mitch wants to talk to someone who knew Superman and Jimmy takes him to Bibbo's to eat. We follow Lois who heads to Clark's apartment of course she is mourning over the loss of Clark. She opens the door and cries of course but also there are Ma and Pa Kent.They came to settle Clark's things in order as well as Lana Lang.

We head over to the Metropolis Post Office. Every Christmas, Superman would read the mail sent to him and try to make miracles happen. This is the business the heroes will try to do in Superman's absence Of course Guy Gardner scoffs at the idea and Wonder Woman puts him in his place. There are letters for Superman to help find hidden cities and gold.There is even a letter from a lady who is terminal who wants Superman to find her lost son of over 30 years. For once Guy Gardner does something nice and he takes that case. Wonder Woman reads a letter from a woman whose house was destroyed she just wanted to thank him for saving her family's lives. So they agree to put out a helping hand.

Back at Bibbo's restaurant Jimmy and Mitch are eating sitting with Bibbo and talking. Jimmy finally remembers Mitch from being in the news due to Superman and Doomsday fight that destroyed his house. He still is feeling like it's his fault and Bibbo does his best to make him feel better. Bibbo gives Mitch air fare to get home. Back at Clark's place Lana decides its best the world should know Clark and Superman are one and the same.Eventually though they decide to stay quiet about Clark's private life thanks to the calmness of Pa Kent's urging.

Wonder Woman reaches a apartment of a Roger Anderson. I guess he is Mitch's dad. Wonder Women tells him about his wife and kids and their house destroyed by Doomsday.

The story splits up as the heroes are doing what they can. Jimmy takes Mitch to Superman's memorial site. Green Lantern and Flash are building Mitch's mom a new house, talk about Christmas miracles. Wonder Woman brings Mitch's dad to the new house and apparently things will work out and Cadmus Labs is underground of the memorial and is taking the casket of superman of course this will be Superboy.

Notes:

  • Joker, Martha and Thomas Wayne cameo flashback appearance.
  • Triangle 1993 #6.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #20.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #499.
name: Funeral for a Friend Part 4: Metropolis Mailbag II

description:
While Luthor continues to pursue Superman's body, Jonathan Kent arrives at the hospital. Will Pa survive, or will he join his son in the afterlife?

The Kents were the first to find the infant Kal-El when he arrived on Earth. They took him in and raised him as their own. This issue explores a father's grief. It's never easy when a parent outlives their child. It gets even worse when this grief causes Jonathan Kent to have a heart attack. Plus, Lex Luthor's epitaph to his fallen enemy.

Notes:

  • "DC Universe" one page text piece featuring "R.I.P. Superman" what's new for 1993 to include Vertigo leaving DC, "New Stars on the Horizon" featuring the debut of Darkstars in their own title, "How to Draw Lobo" and "DC Bullets" Lee Moder makes his debut in Wonder Woman #72, Scott Peterson and Bill Kaplan are DC's newest editors, Tim Truman and John Ostrander team up for the last issue of Hawkworld #32 and Kevin Dooley paid $10 and a ham sandwich to get his name in this issue of DC Universe.
  • Series goes on a two month hiatus till June 1993.
  • Triangle 1993 #10.
  • Chronological continuation from Action Comics #686.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #500.
name: Funeral for a Friend Part 8: The End

description:
Reign of the Supermen! "Alive!" Guest-starring the Guardian. Can it be true...has the Man of Steel returned from the grave? Someone, or something, has arrived with the look and power of the fallen hero, and he's here for Doomsday. Woe to any that would stand in his way. Includes a poster titled "The Man of Tomorrow!" NOTE: Check out Action Comics #687, Adventures of Superman #500, and Superman: The Man of Steel #22 to follow the adventures of the other Supermen.

Notes:

  • The newstand edition was $1.50.
  • The direct sales edition was $1.95.
  • The direct sales cover is die-cut.
  • There is an outline of the "S" shield is on the outer cover while the "S" shield belongs to Cyborg Superman on the inner cover.
  • The direct sales and newstand covers were penciled by Dan Jurgens, inked by Brett Breeding and colored by Glenn Whitmore.
  • Story continues from Adventures of Superman #500.
  • "The Man of Tommorrow!" a poster of Cyborg Superman by Dan Jurgens and Brett Breeding.
  • Triangle 1993 #14.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #22.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #501.
name: Alive

description:
Reign of the Supermen tie-in.

Four men of power have arrived, seemingly out of nowhere, and all claim to be the Man of Steel incarnate. Daily Planet reporter Ronald Troupe writes an expose exploring the facts and mystery behind the return of Superman, or Supermen, as the case maybe.

Notes:

  • "DC Universe 10" one page text piece featuring "Larger Than Life: The Atom!", "The Man is Back! or is He?" and "DC Bullets" featuring a Lobo movie?, Stuart Immonen is a father, Phil Jimenez speaks at his old alma mater the School of Visual Arts to speak to the students and Dan Jurgens is a father. The Atom artwork by Steve Dillon, Superman(?) artwork by Jon Bogdanove and Dennis Janke and Conner Jones Immonen by Ron Boyd.
  • Triangle 1993 #18.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #23.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #502.
name: Prove It

description:
Reign of the Supermen! "Deadly Alliance!" The Cyborg-Superman and the Kryptonian make war for the right to be the one true Superman, and Coast City is caught in the middle. Plus, Lex Luthor is beside himself. With his greatest enemy lying in his final resting place, the nefarious villain must now contend with four doppelgangers who all claim the mantle of Superman. Plus, a shocking final page you just can't miss.

Notes:

  • Cameo headshots of Steel and Superboy.
  • This is a dark chapter in the history of the DC Universe. One that leads to the fall from grace of one hero (Hal Jordan). Destruction of Coast City (leads to Green Lantern's Emerald Twilight).
  • Triangle 1993 #22.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #24.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #503.
name: Deadly Alliance

description:
Reign of the Supermen! "Resurrections!" Guest-starring Supergirl, Superboy and Steel. The one true Man of Steel has returned! Now, Superman, along with the new Superboy and the man called Steel, must prepare themselves for the final battle with the treacherous Cyborg-Superman and his sinister accomplice, Mongul.

Notes:

  • "DC Universe 12" one page text piece featuring "Are You a Guy's Guy?" a Guy Gardner challenge with humorous questions and multiple choice answers. Plus, "How to Draw Robin" and "DC Bullets" which welcomes Peter Tomasi, Mike McAvennie and Keri Kowalski to the DC family, match the editor to their assistant editor and the creation of a new studio in North Carolina by Mike Wieringo, Richard Case, John Love and Chuck Wojtkiewicz. Guy Gardner artwork by Joe Staton and Terry Beatty and Robin artwork by Tom Grummett and Scott Hanna.
  • Triangle 1993 #26.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #25.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #504.
name: Resurrections

description:
This is it--Superman vs. Cyborg Superman! Even with help from Superboy, Steel, Supergirl, and the returning Eradicator, does Superman have a chance to win a battle against an enemy so powerful?!

Part of the Reign of the Supermen storyline. Its Mongul and the Cyborg Superman against Superman, Superboy, Supergirl, Steel, the Eradicator, and Hal Jordan in what remains of Coast City.

Notes:

  • Newstand and direct sales edition priced at $2.00.
  • Foil cover edition priced at $3.50.
  • Foil cover edition contains no ads.
  • Foil cover edition contains the creator's data.
  • Newstand and direct sales edition the creator's data is missing.
  • Read Green Lantern #46 prior to reading this issue.
  • Triangle 1993 #30.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #26.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #505.
name: Back For Good!

description:
Guest-starring Batman (Azrael) & the Justice League. Superman is back! As the Man of Steel makes his rounds to announce his return, he soon learns the DC Universe is a much different place than the one he left a few months ago. First stop...Gotham City, where a new person wears the mantle of the Bat.

Notes:

  • At this time in DC history Azrael took over as Batman for Bruce Wayne, who was nursing a broken back - courtesy of the hulking villain Bane.
  • Engine City is destroyed.
  • Triangle 1993 #34.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #27.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #506.
name: Funeral for a Friend Epilogue: On the Edge

description:
The Toyman is back and more dangerous than ever. And this time the diabolical villain will use the son of Cat Grant as a pawn in his deadly game.

"Toys" Part 1 of 2. The Toyman is back and more dangerous than ever. And this time the diabolical villain will use the son of Cat Grant as a pawn in his deadly game. Nothing will prepare you for the tragic ending in this one.

Notes:

  • Jimmy Olsen was dressed up as Turtle Boy for Halloween.
  • Triangle 1993 #38.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #28.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #507.
name: Toys

description:
"The Last Sun Devil" While lost in space, thanks to Lobo (see Superman: The Man of Steel #30), Superman gets caught in the middle of two warring factions. Can the Man of Steel determine who is the good guy and who is the bad guy in this alien dispute before it's too late?

Notes:

  • Triangle 1994 #6.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #30.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #509.
name: The Last Sun Devil

description:
Bizarro's World! Part 1 of 5. "Bizarro!" Back in Man of Steel #5 Lex Luthor created a clone of the Man of Steel. This Frankenstein-like creature transformed into a disfigured parody of the original and became Bizarro, one of Superman's most dangerous enemies. Soon after its creation the Bizarro creature was destroyed but not before causing all sorts of chaos and destruction. You'd think that Luthor would have learned his lesson from this previous failure. Don't bet on it.

Notes:

  • Triangle 1994 #10.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #31.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #510.
name: Bizarro

description:
The Man of Steel finds himself helpless and uncontrollably growing in outer space. What has caused his sudden mutation, and can he be cured before it's too late?

"Desperation!" Part 4 of 5. The Man of Steel finds himself helpless and uncontrollably growing in outer space. What has caused his sudden mutation, and can he be cured before it's too late? Meanwhile, Lex Luthor makes things uncomfortable for Lois Lane at the Daily Planet.

Notes:

  • Lois Lane is fired from the Daily Planet.
  • "DC Universe" a one page text piece honoring the memory of Jack Kirby.
  • Triangle 1994 #18.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #33.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #512.
name: Desperation

description:
The Battle for Metropolis! Part 3 of 4. "Battle Ground Metropolis" Guest-starring the Guardian. The Guardian has fallen victim to the clone disease, but does his body hold the key to the cure? Plus, a villain dies in this issue and the war heats up even more.

Notes:

  • "DC Universe 17" "From the DC High 1994 Yearbook" one page featuring Damage by Bill Marimon and Tom McWeeney, the Ray by Joe Quesada, Anima by Steve Crespo and Chris Ivy, Superboy by Tom Grummett and Doug Hazlewood, Robin by Tom Grummett and Scott Hanna and a good luck note from "Principal Carlin". Each character featured: Voted, Afterschool Activities, Quote and Immediate Plans.
  • Triangle 1994 #22.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #34.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #513.
name: Battle Ground Metropolis

description:
Fall of Metropolis! Part 3 of 5. "My Life!" Lex Luthor is dying and if Luthor can't have Metropolis than he'll see to it that there is no Metropolis! The diabolical villain enacts his endgame plan and unleashes an army of extermination robots on the city he's already crippled.

Notes:

  • Triangle 1994 #26.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #35.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #514.
name: My Life!

description:
Massacre in Metropolis! "Earth Run!" Part 1 of 2. Superman must battle a foe whose strength rivals his own. It's the Man of Steel versus the powerhouse known as Massacre for the fate of the world.

Notes:

  • Adam Grant cameo headshot appearance.
  • A one paragraph dedicated to memory of T. M. Maple who recently passed away. T. M. Maple was an avid letter writer to the various comic book companies from the 1970s to the 1980s.
  • "DC Universe 18" one page advertisement piece with information on the upcoming Chicago Comicon 1994. Included are dates, times and location of the convention plus the creators who will be on hand at the show.
  • Triangle 1994 #30.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Steel #36.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #515.
name: Earth Run

description:
In the catacombs beneath Madripoor's Princess Bar, after being released from the Viper's control, Shadowcat (Kitty Pryde), Phoenix, Rogue, Psylocke, Jubilee, Jessica Drew, Tyger Tiger and Yukio are gathered around Logan and Viper. They stand there aghast as Logan repeats his statement: Viper is his wife. Jubilee and Phoenix express their disbelief and outrage, and shortly, the women, all except for Kitty, leave.

Later, Logan explains to Kitty that he must honor a vow he made to Seraph, the previous owner of the Princess Bar. She had seen him through a particularly difficult time, so he was indebted to her. At this point, Viper was a mercenary who had aided them in a gunfight which left Seraph mortally wounded. She made Logan vow to give Viper whatever she desired. She chose Logan.

Unknown to the pair, a team of killers from both Hydra and the Hand are gathering nearby for an attempt on Logan's life, but they are eliminated by Sabretooth.

That evening, at the clifftop estate of Madripoor's late prince, the ceremony to make the marriage official is about to take place. In attendance are the bride and groom, the officiant and Kitty. With little fanfare, the couple are wed, but without warning, Sabretooth appears and kills the officiant. He takes a vicious swipe at Viper, but Kitty is there to make her intangible. Nonetheless, the savage blow still causes Viper extreme pain. Kitty gets her into the palace to safety while Logan and his nemesis brawl.

Despite Sabretooth's healing factor exhibiting increased speed, Logan seems to gain the upper hand and he presses his advantage. As they tumble into a pool, Kitty watches from a balcony above, trying to puzzle out why Viper felt pain while phased. She recalls a Danger Room session early in her time with the X-Men when Wolverine's claws had passed through her phased form. She had felt intense pain, attributing it to the density of the adamantium his skeleton was then laced with.

As Logan rises from the pool, hauling up his foe's limp figure, Kitty's realization hits her and she shouts a warning to Logan, albeit, too late. Sabretooth leaps to his feet, having feigned unconsciousness, and begins to savagely slash at Logan. He boastfully confirms what Kitty had deduced: his skeleton is now augmented with adamantium.

He continues his assault, breaking off all of Logan's claws, and is about to deliver a lethal blow, when Kitty phases Logan out of the way. She manages to roll his unconscious body over the edge of the cliff into the sea below, but having just passed through Sabretooth's adamantium bones, she remains tangible and at the mercy of his next slash.
name: Blood Wedding

description:
Logan (Wolverine) is in the Himalayas, climbing Mount Namjagbarwa Feng, having accepted a mission from Viper, with whom he shares a marriage of convenience. Viper told him she had sent twelve Hydra agents to the mountain to follow a lead on the location of the legendary Shangri-La. Only three returned, apparently suffering from a deadly and highly contagious virus. Viper had asked Logan to find the source and return with a sample so that she could develop an antidote against a likely outbreak.

While Logan climbs, Viper receives updates on his progress. Then she visits the quarantine area where the three infected agents are being treated, learning one has died and the second is close to expiring. Before much longer, all three are dead, and she orders their bodies be tossed into an acid pit.

Meanwhile, Logan follows the trail of the agents to a cave within which he finds one of the Hydra goons, alive, but cowering in fear. Logan questions the soldier and gets closer to the truth of the matter. He tells Logan a monk had visited Viper and had provided some information. Subsequently, she had dispatched the team to the mountain to obtain a sample of the virus, under the pretense of exploring for an ancient city. They had found nothing.

During the descent, the team had gotten separated in a storm. Of the dozen, he remained, while only three others made it back to Madripoor. When Logan tells the agent they were infected, the agent counters that most likely, Viper poisoned them. Suddenly, the agent screams as the source of his fear, an alien arachnid creature, enters the cave.

The thing stings Logan with its venomous barbed tongue. Logan extends his claws and fights back, but the creature continues to strike Logan with the whip-like appendage. The toxins coursing through his veins weaken Logan, forcing him to collapse. The alien then approaches the Hydra goon, but Logan's healing-factor allows him enough of a recovery to leap at the thing. He severs its tongue and proceeds to hack at it. The creature then lunges at Logan, but impales itself upon his claws.

Logan and the Hydra agent exit the cave, and the X-MÃ¥n tosses an explosive inside. As they descend, he tells the goon to go into hiding, since Viper does not tolerate failure.

Logan returns to Madripoor with a vial containing a piece of the alien's tongue, which Viper is eager to accept. However, fully aware of her intent to use it to develop new poisons, Logan tosses the vial into the acid pit. Angrily, Viper tells him he had been tracked and so she knows the location of the cave, and will send men to retrieve another sample.

Some time later, a Hydra helicopter futilely hovers above the smoking remains of the cave.

[Note: There are two versions of this issue. The comic was first distributed with a racial slur in a word balloon on page 5. When the text was noticed, Marvel recalled the issue and distributed new copies which contained the proper text:

"Though the ceremony was interrupted by one of our closest foes, the killer known as Sabretooth..."

The original text read as follows:

"Though the ceremony was interrupted by one of our closest foes, the kike known as Sabretooth..."

Even with the recall, many of these issues had already been sold or distributed, making it easy to obtain the recalled edition.]
name: It Fell To Earth

description: The final confrontation between Jarek and the evil Malesur is here. The Magik really hits the fan as the heroes of the lights struggle against the overwhelming forces of the dark. Mysteries are revealed. The "Other" discovered, and heroes and friends in jeopardy.

The long-awaited conclusion, and this one has all the answers. Jarek's final confrontation with Malesur. Also featuring a preview of the upcoming Tellos Special, Tellos: Maiden Voyage, an all-new Tale of Serra's First Trip on the Sheva-Nova, by Todd Dezago and French artist, Crisse.

Steve "The Dude" Rude joins with all-star writer Kurt Busiek to tell a classic, stand-alone tale of Thor!Â  It's a trio of interlocking legends of Thor, spanning the centuries from the Thunder God's boyhood to today! Two young viking warriors learn the story of the storm that rebelled against Thor at the urging of Loki, a storm that would one day become the Godstorm! Also, the mighty Avengers face a new and powerful enemy in their earliest days as a team! If you liked SPIDER-MAN: LIFELINES, you'll love THOR: GODSTORM!Â  THE WRITER SPEAKS: "It`s pretty sweeping in scope, I was looking to do something that would deal with Thor as god, Thor as myth, within the context of Thor as Marvel character," explained Busiek. "I was a nut for Norse mythology long before I was a comics reader, and I wanted to get some of that feel into things. When I was invited to write this project, I talked to Steve and outlined the approach I wanted to take, with mythic overtones and a legendary feel, and he got very enthusiastic about it, so I`m plotting the book very much to that core idea, the idea that these aren`t just adventures, they`re legends, and they should feel that way. And then Steve draws them, and that`s where his style comes into play, he`s reinterpreting and repacing my plots in his own way, and making the story richer and more powerful as he does so. Steve`s already done with #2, so we`re working on the final issue already." Â  Â

The millennium-spanning legends of Thor continue! As the trolls wage war on Asgard, Thor is trapped on Earth between the machinations of Loki and a raging super-villain empowered by the legendary Godstorm! And, in the present day, the threat of the Godstorm is reborn! Â  Â

In present day, Thor faces his final confrontation with the lethal Godstorm! And as the myths of the Thunder God are tied together across the ages, the trickster Loki stands ready to reap the whirlwind! Â  Â
It's execution day for the Thunderbolts, but Meteorite's got a plan. Will it save the Thunderbolts or simply her own skin?
name: Casualties of War

description:
No sooner does the team return to Earth, than they are hunted by the hordes of S.H.I.E.L.D.! Will the Thunderbolts be able to escape a vigilant taskforce much stronger than their own? Baron Zemo and Techno return!

The Thunderbolts go into hiding and pick up secret identities as well as part time jobs. SHIELD finds out who the Thunderbolts really are and attack them, but the Thunderbolts escape. At the end, the Great Lakes Avengers, now known as the Lightning Rods, attack the Thunderbolts.
name: Wanted Dead or Alive!

description:
S.H.I.E.L.D. is determined to make the Thunderbolts pay for their betrayal, but will Nick Furyâs forces turn up empty? Citizen V continues a path of devastation leaving enemy and ally in danger! Zemo and Techno return!

The thunderbolts fight the Lightning Rods Aka. the Great Lakes Avengers. Also Citizen V returns, but wasn't Zemo Citizen V?
name: Thunder & Lightning

description:
Graviton rumbles back on the scene! Plus, an unusual battle ensues between Baron Zemo and Citizen V. Witness an old fashioned duel you have to read to believe!

Graviton is back again. Also: Zemo vs. Citizen V
name: Matters of Gravity

description: Have the Thunderbolts reverted to their villainous ways? The pressure of being full time heroes catches up with the team, and allegiances shift. Abandoned by the media, and in the court of ill-favored public opinion, the Thunderbolts may have no choice but to drop the super hero gig and embrace the cloak of villainy!
name: Career opportunities

description: The Thunderbolts are back for more stunning action in the conclusion to their second story arc! The team is tasked with saving a town sieged by evil. Will the Thunderbolts save the day, and win back the publicâs adoration?
name: Heat & Pressure

description:
DECISIONS PART 1

The Thunderbolts thought they were the Masters of Evilâ¦until a new super powered team crashes the scene! The Thunderbolts do battle with the new Masters of Evil, and the aftermath is devastation. The turning point issue that sets the stage for Avengers vs. Thunderbolts!
name: Decisions Part 1: Turning Point

description: Mild-mannered Songbird taps into her inner Screaming Mimi with berserker rage. What has caused this sudden shift for the songstress? The Thunderbolts reel as one of their own flies off the handle, and into the cuckooâs nest!
name: Decisions part 2: Trust

description:
The avenging Hawkeye sets a plan in motion to take down the T-bolts. Hercules returns for revenge against Atlas. A supersized battle between two awesome, god-like beings!

The Thunderbolts are assaulted by a vengeful Hercules, Hawkeye manages to convince him to leave at the cost of their friendship, M.A.C.H. 1 decides to turn himself in to the police in order to convey the team's sincerity.
name: Decisions Part 3: Taking A Stand

description:
After a battle with the Avengers, the Thunderbolts' leader steps down, but who will take their place? There is one candidate, but it won't go over well with the rest of the teamâ¦

MACH 1 turns himself in, the Thunderbolts get back on the goodside of the public due to Hawkeye's involvement, Charcoal joins the team, and U.S. Agent and the Jury attack the Thunderbolts, but lose. Hawkeye then announces that the Thunderbolts are going to bring down the Crimson Cowl's Masters of Evil on national television much to the surprise of the team.
name: Public Relations -OR- Do Not Pass Go.  Do Not Collect $200.

description: The return of the mysterious Citizen V! But is he here to lead the Thunderbolts - or to take them down?! That's the question Hawkeye has to answer as the T-Bolts square off once again against the Masters of Evil! Two fights have ended with mixed results - who will win this final grudge match showdown?!
name: The Eye of the Storm

description: The Thunderbolts set to combat a new incarnation of the Masters of Evil lead by Crimson Cowl amongst 25 other powerful foes. Moonstone's past is also reflected in flashbacks.
name: Saving the World

description:
"Lockdown"

For the good of the team, he gave up his liberty to atone for his sins. Now MACH-1 is back in prison, surrounded by the super-villains who used to be his peers - and who now want him dead! Will a prison break gone awry restore his freedom - or just give the Rhino, Boomerang and Whirlwind the chance to finish him off?
name: Lockdown

description: From the pages of X-MEN flies the Archangel! The Thunderbolts have a new headquarters, a new transport ship and a new mission: to prove themselves by taking down the biggest villains at large! Their first target: Graviton! Their surprising ally: the X-Man known as Archangel! Now that he's no longer hangin' with the X-Men, will Warren Worthington III join the T-Bolts?!
name: Flight Plans

description: With Archangel flying to their side, the Thunderbolts battle Graviton! They couldn't beat him before, so what makes them think they have a chance now? Will the aid of Archangel turn the tide - or will the master of gravity pull the high flier from the sky?!
name: Castles in the Air

description: Can Jolt defeat a foe that has squashed the entire team?! The Thunderbolts and Archangel have been conquered by Graviton, who intends to have them executed as insurrectionists to his new Sky Nation! Now Jolt and Charcoal the Burning Man must grasp victory from the jaws of defeat, if they can find a way to take down a foe who controls a primal force of nature! Guest-starring X-51, the Machine Man!
name: The Fundamental Force

description: Â Eric seemingly kills the god Seth. The Avengers try to take him in and are defeated in battle.Â

Overview

The Titans are building their new Tower in the Titans Island when a goup of H.I.V.E. members attack them. The team is reunited in a Dock Side Diner thinking about the reunion and what members will be in the new group. On the other hand, Damien Darhk is recruting members for H.I.V.E.
name: That Strange Buzzing Sound

description:
Overview

When the battle against H.I.V.E. is over Superman appears to see whatÂ´s going on. Justin take advantage that the team is busy talking to Superman and activates to the Queen bee, a big robot destroyed by Superman with just a hit. Superman helps the team to track the responsable for this and they travel to Brazil. Nightwing asks to Superman to go away and let them alone. The Titans work as a team for first time destroying a H.I.V.E. base.
name: Foundations

description: The horrors of the movie screen come to life to terrorize the Titans. The internet is full of cries for help from the Titans and splatter-movie star Goth is behind it all. Goth's plan is revealed that He's collecting the souls of his fans and sending them to his hell Dimension called Dis.
name: Shock Value

description: Goth brings to life movie screen horrors in order to collect the souls of his fans and send them to his hell dimension.
name: The Dissing

description:
The Titans help the city of Four Heroes, and face Siren.

Siren has made the entire city of Four Heroes, Maine have hydrophobia, so the Titans come to help the townspeople.
name: Fall For The Siren

description:
Green Lantern guest-stars as Red Panzer attacks Troia and Arsenal! The Panzer's willing to burn all of Harlem (with the help of his neo-Nazi commandos) to kill our heroes, but Kyle Rayner isn't about to let that happen!

Troia and Arsenal battle the new Red Panzer, assisted by Green Lantern, which causes more than a little tension. In the process, Troia and Panzer are buried under a collapsed building, and the Panzer reveals that even though he is using a Nazi identity, he is part black, and is deeply ashamed of this. When they are rescued, Troia opens up a bit to the two men in her life, both of whom are very supportive.

Meanwhile, Chanda, who is of Quraci descent, learns that Lian's mother is Cheshire, the woman who destroyed her country. Soon afterward, Cyborg discovers them both to be missing.
name: Heritage
